attributes.value: Dental cavities have been identified as the most common chronic disease for children. Nationally, 19.4% of children have dental decay or cavities.
attributes.name: Rationale

value_obj.value: Dental cavities have been identified as the most common chronic disease for children. Nationally, 19.4% of children have dental decay or cavities.

attributes.value: Children who have dental decay or cavities are less likely to be in very good or excellent overall health than children without decay or cavities. Children with decay are also more likely to have other oral health problems such as toothaches, broken teeth, and bleeding gums.
attributes.name: Clinical Recommendation Statement

value_obj.value: Children who have dental decay or cavities are less likely to be in very good or excellent overall health than children without decay or cavities. Children with decay are also more likely to have other oral health problems such as toothaches, broken teeth, and bleeding gums.

attributes.value: A lower score indicates better quality
attributes.name: Improvement Notation

value_obj.value: A lower score indicates better quality
